channel.title: Gordon Freeman is not the good guy
channel.description:
He kills hundreds of soldiers, human and alien, who are only following orders, mostly unwillingly, from superiors who are only trying to protect their species and work for the greater good. He is given a chance to surrender to the HECU marines, but doesn't, and keeps on killing. He makes a deal with the devil to escape an accident that may have been partially his fault. He murders Breen, who is simply a figurehead bureaucrat who seems to have good intention for humanity, even if he is a little misguided, and has not directly hurt anyone.
I'm not saying that Freeman is a bad guy, he's just not a total hero sometimes.
"Tell me, Dr. Freeman, if you can. You have destroyed so much. What is it, exactly, that you have created? Can you name even one thing? I thought not."

item.title: Gordon Freeman is not the good guy
item.dc:creator: dagrox94
item.description:
He may not be a total hero all the time, but hell he’s only human. And hell, if something shot lightning at me, I wouldn’t hesitate to bust a cap in its ass.
Also, I believe that someone DID try to give these aliens a chance, only to get shockwaved. Freeman’s Mind comes to…mind.

item.title: Gordon Freeman is not the good guy
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
xalener:

That’s the one thing I always liked about HL’s story. All combat is self defense, really. If you look at the big picture, you’ve been killing repurposed POWs (that are prisoners of something Gordon unleashed) for the most part. Thinking about it, I’m not sure if there even is a good guy or bad guy in the HL universe. Just people with different clashing intentions. I bet we’ll find out the combine are only taking other worlds to save their dieing orphan children or some shit like that.

Gordon didn’t create that or unleash it. However, Gordon DID directly and indirectly execute the final part of the plan tho. G-Man warned Eli about the test. Wasn’t it the characters in DECAY that caused the cascade?

Read full topic
item.source: Gordon Freeman is not the good guy

What about the HECU? They slaughtered scientists by the hundreds and most of them complained that they were too easy as targets.

Actually only 1 complained, and later on another complains about killing people.

item.title: Gordon Freeman is not the good guy
item.dc:creator: lambda
item.description:
Errr… the aliens where doing it in instinct; so it’s self defence.
The soldiers are attacking him due to orders; they dont think: hey, this is wrong, so self defence too.
The combine took over the earth, eeh, fighting back is quite obvious.
Shall i name more arguments that gordon IS the good guy?

My dad tends to say “motorsacle” instead of “motorcycle,” “clifft” instead of “cliff,” and many further grammatical atrocities.

Edit: To keep on topic, Gordon is the good guy, the Combine are evil bastards, and Dr. Breen deserves what’s coming to him.

/thread

item.title: Gordon Freeman is not the good guy
item.dc:creator: Kent_Slak
item.description:
Gordon is not fighting because of the contract, if this was a real life situations he could go to the combine and get shot if he wanted this to be over.

The thing is that Gordon Freeman is you and you are Gordon Freeman so if you play like a hero than you are a Hero. The whole half life game is made so that you can step as Gordon Freeman. So it’s your desicions that shows if Gordon/You are a hero or a vilian (sorry for bad english ;D) :freeman:

If it was possible to ask a rebel, or a friend of Gordon Freeman like Barney or Dr. Kleiner he would probably describe him as a hero who is willing to fight for freedom, since he is’t force in to it, he could walk away any time.

No he can’t, he’s under contract with the G-Man’s ‘employers’.
